ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Interesting course to take if you're interested in modern history
Yes, it provides a great backdrop of one of the core fundamentals of IR: the balance of power.framing the theory in 20 century historical context is really valuable.

The course is a survey of 20th century great power history/conflict and an introduction to balance of power theories. The first half of the course focuses on WWI and WWII, and the second half focuses on the Cold War and contemporary issues. The course is highly recommended for those looking to develop/refresh their command of theories of great power relations.
it's a great way to learn realist IR theories and warfare. it's an excellent combination of history and politics, military affairs and political games. the lecturer is amazing. recommend.
I would recommend it to a student with minimal background in international relations.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It provides a great overview of balance of power theory and what that means for the world we live in.
The theoretical knowledge, particularly regarding nuclear weapons theory were very helpful for me.
Yes, as stated before, understanding BOP is so key in understanding IR as a whole.
since i have no IR background, it really helps me to understand basic theories. plus i love warfare, so this class is the right mix.
It improved my knowledge of several areas of international relations theory.
